title: Global slowdown in factory growth hits stock markets - business live | Business | The Guardian
summary: markets slump on global growth worries .
world markets hit by factory slowdown .
brazil 's factory output slips into contraction .
france defiant over austerity in 2015 budget .
us private sector created 213,000 jobs last month .
pound hits two week low after pmi report .

text: over to greece , and a meeting between prime minister antonis samaras and his deputy evangelos venizelos has begun in a bid to smooth over growing signs of friction in athens ' two-party coalition .

helena smith writes : the two men , on the second day of talks in the capital with negotiators representing the country 's troika '' of creditors at the eu , ecb and imf , are reportedly at loggerheads over the way the talks are being handled .

samaras asked for the meeting after the greek finance minister , gikas hardouvelis , a technocrat believed to be more in line with venizelos ' pasok party , went ballistic '' when the greek leader insisted on one of his most trusted advisers sitting in on negotiations hardouvelis was conducting with mission chiefs on tuesday .

growing speculation of early elections - in both the media and government circles - has added to the need for the two leaders to come up with a concrete strategy that will define targets and goals , '' one insider said .

samaras has repeatedly said that his government will live out its four-year term but the need to find a replacement for the incumbent president - and the opposition 's threats to block the government 's candidate - may well force early elections in the coming months , throwing debt-stricken greece , the euro zone 's weakest link , into renewed political turmoil .
european central bank mission chief for greece klaus masuch arrives at the finance ministry in athens .
photo : reuters/alkis konstantinidis and on that note , it 's time to shut up for the evening .
thanks for all you comments and we 'll be back tomorrow for , among other things , the latest european central bank meeting .

documents.title: markets slump on global growth worries
text: a series of disappointing manufacturing surveys from around the globe - from china to germany , from the uk to us - has got october and the final quarter of the year off to a bad start , writes nick fletcher .

added to investors concerns about an economic slowdown were geopolitical worries - repercussions from the hong kong protests , the air strikes on isis - and the news of a diagnosed ebola case in the us .
back with the economy , and all eyes will be on the european central bank 's latest meeting on thursday and the us non-farm payroll numbers on friday .

meanwhile , here are the closing scores in the markets : the ftse 100 finished down 65.20 points or 0.98 % at 6557.52 , its lowest level since april germany 's dax dropped 0.97 % to 9382.03 france 's cac closed down 1.15 % at 4365.27 italy 's ftse mib lost 0.89 % to 20,706.31 spain 's ibex ended 0.67 % lower at 10,753.2 on wall street , the dow jones industrial average is currently down 188 points or 1.1 % .

documents.title: mid-afternoon summary
text: time for another catch-up .
world stock markets have fallen back this afternoon as investors fret over global growth prospects .
america 's factories grew at a slower rate than expected and brazil 's manufacturers suffered a contraction .
france 's government has announced that it will not get its deficit below 3 % of gdp until 2017 , declaring that it will not impose more austerity .
german firms are not impressed .
there is better news on jobs , though : ireland 's unemployment rate has fallen .
and us private firms created 213,000 new jobs last month over in athens , talks are underway between the troika and the greek government .
and greece is preparing to welcome ec president-elect jean claude juncker on friday .
reminder , my late-morning summary outlines how uk and eurozone factory growth was weaker than expected in september .

documents.title: world markets hit by factory slowdown
text: world stock markets are falling this afternoon as today 's flurry of weaker-than-expected manufacturing output data spook investors .
europe 's main markets are all in the red , with the ftse 100 down 71 points or around 1 % .
france 's cac is leading the fallers , down 1.3 % .
here 's the latest damage : european stock markets , 3.30pm today .
reuters traders are reacting to the news that factory growth in the uk and across the eurozone slowed last month , with manufacturing in the german powerhouse unexpectedly stalling .
on wall street the dow has shed 150 points in early trading .

cnbc newsroom ( @ cnbcnow ) stocks sink and dow drops 150-plus points after factory data : traders say that today 's private sector employment report ( details here ) , showing that over 200,000 new jobs were created last month , is also hitting shares ; on speculation that it makes an early us interest rate rise more likely .

marketwatch ( @ marketwatch ) stocks moved lower after adp data raised concerns that the fed may tighten policy sooner : talk of a fed rate hike has driven the dollar steadily higher in recent weeks .

ashraf laidi , chief global strategist at city index , says this could spark a selloff : with evidence showing that a rising us dollar begins to hurt smaller cap stocks before it spills over onto bigger cap companies , this would be another excuse to wave the red flag warning for larger cap stocks .

documents.title: us factory growth slows down
text: america 's manufacturing sector has also seen growth slow last month , confirming that the world 's factories lost momentum in september .
the ism us manufacturing activity index fell to 56.6 , from 59 in august , meaning it expanded at a slower rate .
new orders and employment growth both slowed too .
and in another blow to confidence , us construction spending has fallen by 0.8 % in august , dashing expectations of a 0.5 % rise .
cnbc newsroom ( @ cnbcnow ) ism manufacturing index hits 56.6 in september vs. 58.0 expectation ; construction spending dips 0.8 % in august :
the international monetary fund has also suggested for top bankers ' pay to be changed , so that senior executives are paid in debt as well as cash and shares .
that would help to make them more concerned about long-term stability , it argues , and defer risky behaviour .
more on the ft : imf calls for shake-up of bank executive pay

documents.title: imf sounds alarm on shadow banking
text: the imf has raised concerns over shadow banking - lending from non-bank financial companies , which has grown strongly in recent years .
in its biannual review of global financial stability , it warns that britain 's shadow banking sector is more than twice the size of any other economy 's as a share of gdp .

but america 's shadow banking is the biggest worry because , the imf says , the us is the only country where shadow banking assets are greater than those of the conventional bank full story : imf warns on size of uk shadow banking sector

documents.title: brazil 's factory output slips into contraction
text: brazil 's factory sector has slipped back into contraction .
the brazil manufacturing pmi , calculated by hsbc , fell to 49.3 in september , from 50.2 in august .
50 points is the cut-off mark between expansion and contraction .
it highlights the weakness in the country 's economy as brazilians prepare to head to the polls to elect their president .
it also shows that the manufacturing slowdown is n't just confined to europe ( see earlier summary for details ) .
hsbc reports that brazilian manufacturing operating conditions worsened in september , reversing the modest improvement recorded in august . ''
firms reported that production output and new orders fell last month , and cut jobs for the second month running .

brazilian factory pmi , september 2014 here are the key points : output contracts following expansion in previous month modest reductions in new orders and foreign business input costs fall for first time in over five years andre loes , chief economist for brazil at hsbc , says brazil 's factory sector has suffered for much of 2014 after an incipient recovery in august ( 50.2 ) , the hsbc brazil manufacturing pmi is back below the neutral level , at 49.3 in september .
this is the fifth time the index has shown a contraction in 2014 .
only two out of the eleven sub-indexes remained above 50 , suggesting a broad- based weakening .
with the september figure , the manufacturing pmi closes the 3q2014 at 49.6 , suggesting that the brazilian manufacturing industry remained in contraction after shrinking in 2q . ''

documents.title: pwc gives belfast a jobs boost
text: financial services giant pricewaterhousecooper has announced it is creating more than 800 jobs in belfast marking a major boost to the northern ireland economy today , ireland correspondent henry mcdonald writes .
more than 300 of the posts will be for trained accountants including graduates in the company 's new financial services centre in the city .
a further 500 will join staff augmentation '' teams in pwc 's global client businesses at its belfast office .
the jobs represent an investment of over £ 40m by pwc which includes a grant of £ 4 million from the state body invest ni .

first minister of northern ireland peter robinson said the investment was a tremendous boost to the northern ireland economy and is another significant vote of confidence in northern ireland 's talent '' .
deputy first minister martin mcguinness said local graduates would be the foundation '' for pwc 's business activities worldwide .
pwc , incidentally , are tesco 's auditors , and facing a few questions after the £ 250m profit misreporting came to light

documents.title: juncker to visit athens on friday
text: jean claude juncker , the eu 's president designate , will be making a flying visit to athens this friday , the commission 's press office has announced .
from athens , helena smith reports : the incoming president will hold a working lunch with the greek prime minister antonis samaras in athens before leaving the capital that evening .
this is junker 's second visit since it became clear he would assume the post ( his first foreign visit in his new capacity was to athens in early august ) .

juncker has particularly good relations with samaras - they are both conservatives , and greek officials credit juncker , perhaps more than any other politician , for supporting the debt-stricken country in its most difficult hour at the height of the euro crisis .
during his last visit the former luxembourg prime minister declared that as head of the euro group of euro zone finance ministers , he had fought like a lion '' to keep greece in the euro zone .
the visit had been kept under close wraps and comes at a time when samaras ' fragile two-party coalition is increasingly losing popularity in the polls .
political observers says the surpise drop-in could be as much about boosting samaras at a time when his adversary and strident anti-austerity opponent , alexis tsipras is stepping up his opposition .
tooday in parliament , tsipras declared that samaras 's austerity policies have ruined greece .

documents.title: us private sector created 213,000 jobs last month
text: just in new jobs data from america .
and us private sector companies added 213,000 new jobs last month , according to the closely watched adp employment report .
that 's slightly ahead of expectations ( economists had pencilled in a 205k increase ) .

and it suggests that friday 's non-farm payroll report , the wider measure of the us jobs market , will show that at least 200,000 new jobs were created across the whole economy in september , after sliding to just 142,000 in august .
marketwatch ( @ marketwatch ) helped by a number of industries , adp reports 213,000 private-sector jobs were added

documents.title: german firms unimpressed by french budget
text: france 's declaration that it wo n't lower its deficit below 3 % until 2017 ( details here ) has gone down rather badly with german companies .
reuters has the details : germany 's main exporters ' association , the bga , accused france of putting the euro and the wider regional economy at risk .

the french elite has still not understood that in the 21st century you ca n't get competitive by printing money , '' bga president anton boerner said , according to the text of a speech due for delivery at a conference in berlin .

documents.title: troika talks underway in athens
text: over in greece , the imf 's mission chief to greece , rishi goyal , has arrived at the finance ministry in athens for today 's talks over its bailout programme .

konstantinidis/reuters our athens correspondent , helena smith , writes that the talks wo n't be easy : the two sides are at odds over next year 's budget , the size of the financing gap slated for 2015/16 , the size of the primary surplus greece has crowed is one of its biggest achievements , and whether athens will need a third bailout .
the government , facing stiff opposition from the radical left syriza party now leading in all polls , is determined it does not need a new financial assistance programme .
prime minister antonis samaras told mps over the weekend that greece has exited the memorandum '' accord with its creditors and will be forging ahead with tax breaks .
ireland 's unemployment rate has fallen again , to 11.1 % in september .

the number of people claiming jobless benefits fell by 4,700 in september 2014 , bringing the total down to 374,800.. 's central statistics office a year ago , as ireland was approaching the end of its bailout programme , the unemployment rate was 12.6 % .. 's central statistics office

documents.title: france defiant over austerity in 2015 budget
text: french finance minister michel sapin addresses reporters during the presentation of the 2015 budget , at the finance ministry in paris this morning .
de la mauviniere/ap meanwhile in paris , the french government has unveiled its new budget , and admitted that it wo n't hit the eu deficit targets until 2017 .
the budget includes a €21bn cost-cutting plan , but even that wo n't bring the french deficit below 3 % until two years later than previously agreed with brussels .
finance minister michel sapin declared that : these spending cuts are crucial to our credibility in the eyes of french and europeans , they 'll be fully applied . ''

but the finance ministry was also adamant that it would not aim to cut the deficit any faster : the french people will not be asked to make additional efforts because , although the government is aware of the seriousness of the budgetary situation it refuses to impose austerity . ''
under the latest plan , france 's budget deficit will rise to 4.4 % in 2015 , before falling to 4.3 % in 2016 and then 2.8 % in 2017 .
france 's economy is now to grow by just 0.4 % this year , then 1.0 % in 2015 , 1.7 % in 2016 and 1.9 % in 2017 .
sapin admitted that : the economic prospects in france and in europe are not the same that we were promised a few months ago .

and as the ft 's hugh carnegy reports from paris , france made a non-too subtle call to berlin to help stimulate europe 's economy : mr sapin also issued a clear call to germany to do more to boost the eurozone 's weak economy .

he said that while france was facing up to its responsibilities '' , surplus countries that had already had the courage to reform '' needed to pose the question '' of what more they needed to do to recover growth michel sapin ) and junior budget minister christian eckert talking after presenting france 's 2015 draft budget today .
piermont/afp/getty images

documents.title: summary : european factory sector suffers a bad september
text: time for a recap .
the weak eurozone economy is dragging back britain 's factories , experts say , after growth in the uk manufacturing sector fell to its lowest in 17 months .
data firm markit 's monthly pmi report came in at just 51.6 in september , rather weaker than expected , showing that growth slowed last month .
uk manufacturing pmi , september 2014 new orders ground to a near-halt , amid falling demand from several european countries .
markit blamed the ongoing lethargy of the eurozone and the appreciation of sterling against the euro '' .

other analysts called it a worrying sign '' and martin beck , senior economic advisor to the ey item club , says : even with the continued strength of the domestic economy , the manufacturing sector looks set to end 2014 on a disappointing note .
exporters are likely to continue suffering from the strength of sterling .
the pound 's drop in early september was short-lived , with sterling appreciating by over 2 % during the course of the month .
and further signs of weakening sentiment in the euro-zone wo n't help exporters ' endeavours either . ''
the latest eurozone factory data is also a worry .
manufacturing growth across the euro area slowed to a near standstill in september .
and there was an unwelcome surprise from germany , where the factory sector shrank slightly , driven by falling new orders .

eurozone manufacturing pmi , to september 2014 the ukraine crisis , and the tit-for-tat sanctions between russia and the west , appear to be exacerbating europe 's problems , markit says : in a sign of spreading economic malaise , germany , austria and greece all joined france in reporting manufacturing downturns in september .

what 's especially perturbing is that germany 's pmi fell into contraction for the first time since june of last year , suggesting the region 's northern industrial heartland has succumbed to the various headwinds of weak demand within the euro area , falling business and consumer confidence , waning exports due to the ukraine crisis and russian sanctions .
russia 's factories also suffered a drop in output last month .
in other news the city regulator has launched a full investigation into tesco , over its £ 250m profit overstatement .
here 's what it means .
sainsbury 's has blamed tough competition and a deflationary environment '' for a 2.8 % drop in like-for-like sales in the last quarter .
details start here .
britain 's supermarkets are leading the fallers again this morning in the city .
morrisons : down 5.6 % at 158p ( partly because it went 'ex-dividend ' today ) sainsbury : down 4.5 % at 239p , a six year low .
tesco : down 3.5 % at 179p , an 11-year low .

documents.title: germany sells 10-year bunds at record low yield , under 1 %
text: another sign that all is not quite right in the global economy - germany just sold 10-year sovereign debt at an interest below 1 % .
in an auction this morning , the german debt office sold €4.1bn of 10-year bunds at an average yield of just 0.93 % ( ! ) .
that shows investors are looking for a safe haven for their cash , and anticipate eurozone inflation ( and growth ) to remain low for some time .
megan greene ( @ economistmeg ) rt @ twitterid : germany sells 10-year bond below 1 % yield for first time on record .

documents.title: barclays : economic uncertainty is holding factories back
text: and here 's mike rigby , head of manufacturing at barclays , on the uk factory data : after a promising start to q3 , the growth of output and new orders continues to slow bringing a subdued outlook to the end of the quarter .
although the sector is still expanding , manufacturers are holding off raising investment levels until the economic in particular the way forward on interest rates , becomes clearer .
that said , it 's crucial that the sector continues to invest in new product lines , innovation and manufacturing efficiencies . ''
however , the pound has actually risen slightly against the euro today , to €1.2844 .
not a surprise , given that the eurozone factory data was disappointing too ( details here ) , but it wo n't help uk firms boost exports .

documents.title: pound hits two week low after pmi report
text: the news that britain 's factory sector has posted its slowest growth in 17 months sent the pound down to a two-week low of $ 1.616 against the us dollar .
the data could encourage bank of england policymakers to leave interest rates low for longer .

jake trask , corporate dealer at ukforex , explains : given the ongoing strong performance of the service and construction sectors , we still expect a february interest rate rise from the bank of england .
however , this poor manufacturing reading will add weight to the mpc doves ' argument of keeping rates lower for longer . ''
the slowdown in britain 's factories could be a blow to efforts to rebalance the economy .
rob wood of berenberg bank says the uk will remain heavily dependent '' on domestic demand and service sector growth until the eurozone up again .
and with germany 's factories stagnating , that might not happen imminently .
with the conflict in ukraine now frozen confidence on the content could stabilise soon .
but the continuing fall in sentiment in germany suggests a risk that it may be a couple of months yet before that happens .
the uncertainty around last month 's scottish independence vote may also have hit uk factories , according to david richardson , head of manufacturing at lloyds bank commercial banking .
richardson says : the slowdown in manufacturing is worrying , but the market is likely to settle as confidence rebounds on the back of a relatively more stable domestic political backdrop .
management teams must remain focused on building ties with foreign markets , particularly beyond the eurozone , if they are to keep output levels in positive territory . ''

documents.title: cips : eurozone to blame for uk manufacturing slowdown
text: the worrying slowdown in britain 's factory sector last month is primarily due to the weakness of the euro economy , according to david noble , ceo of the chartered institute of purchasing & supply .

noble says : whilst the sector is still expanding , growth is much softer than that seen in the first half of the year and indicates that growth in manufacturing may be harder to find in the final quarter of the year .
the continued weakness in eurozone countries and the euro-sterling exchange rate appeared to particularly undermine growth in september , and resulted in near stagnation in new manufacturing orders .
demand from north america , scandinavia and the middle east did help to offset this slowdown .
however , the eu buys up around half of all uk exports , so the slowdown in the eurozone is a serious worry .

documents.title: uk factory growth hits 17-month low
text: britain 's factory sector has also suffered a bad september , with growth slowing sharply .
the manufacturing pmi , which measures how hundreds of uk firms performed last month , has fallen to 51.6 , from 52.2 in august .
that shows the weakest growth since april 2013 , and is worse than expected .
uk factory pmi , to september 2014 kit juckes ( @ kitjuckes ) whoopsadaisy .
uk pmi 51.6 markit reports that new orders slowed to near-stagnation , a message we also heard from manufacturers across europe this morning ( scroll down for more ) .
new export demand fell , which markit blamed on the strength of the pound against the euro , and weaknesses in the euro area economy '' .
there is a glimmer of good news - job creation accelerated during september .
but rob dobson , senior economist at markit , warns that the strong upsurge in uk manufacturing sector at the start of the year appears to have run its course . ''
inflows of new work slowed in both domestic and export markets .
overseas demand was reined in mainly by the ongoing lethargy of the eurozone and the appreciation of sterling against the euro . ''
and this may encourage the bank of england not to raise interest rates soon , he adds .
reaction to follow
oh dear , the uk 's factory sector has reported its slowest growth since spring 2013 .
details to follow

documents.title: eurozone factory sector growth hits 14-month low
text: the eurozone factory sector has suffered a slowdown last month , dragged back by germany ( see here ) and france ( see here ) .
the overall euro area manufacturing pmi , calculated from this morning 's data from markit , slipped to just 50.3 , a 14-month low , close to stagnation .
markit says the economic malaise '' in europe is spreading , with firms in germany , austria , greece and france all reporting a downturn last month .
new orders fell for the first time since june 2013 , suggesting that demand for europe 's goods has fallen .
and both input and output prices fell , adding to concerns over low inflation .
here are the key charts : .
although italy and spain are highlights , the overall report is worrying .
chris williamson , chief economist at markit said : september 's eurozone pmi makes for gloomy reading .
the euro area 's manufacturing economy has lost the growth momentum seen earlier in the year , lurching closer to stagnation .
the near-term outlook also looks worrying .
order books are now deteriorating for the first time since june of last year , suggesting output could start to fall as we move into the final quarter of the year .

not surprisingly , firms are focusing on cost-cutting , resulting in an ongoing lack of job creation and sending a depressing signal of little hope for any reduction in the region 's near-record unemployment rate .
companies are also cutting prices at the expense of profit margins as they strive to boost sales .
in a sign of spreading deflationary pressures , prices fell in all countries surveyed for the first time in over a year .
in a sign of spreading economic malaise , germany , austria and greece all joined france in reporting manufacturing downturns in september .

what 's especially perturbing is that germany 's pmi fell into contraction for the first time since june of last year , suggesting the region 's northern industrial heartland has succumbed to the various headwinds of weak demand within the euro area , falling business and consumer confidence , waning exports due to the ukraine crisis and russian sanctions .
the weakening manufacturing sector will intensify pressure on the ecb to do more to revive the economy and no doubt strengthen calls for full- scale quantitative easing .
many will hope that this week 's policy meeting will at least show a determination to address the slowdown with details of an aggressive abs and covered bond purchase programme . ''

documents.title: euro slides after weak german factory pmi
text: the euro has fallen by almost half a cent against the us dollar to a new two-year low around $ 1.2595 .
investors are anticipating that the unexpected ( although small ) contraction in germany 's factory sector raises the chances of further stimulus measures from the european central bank .
markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) # euro falls markedly against # dollar on german manufacturing # pmi release
financial experts are n't impressed by the german pmi report : chris adams ( @ chrisadamsmkts ) uh-oh .
germany has stalled joshua raymond ( @ josh cityindex ) german manufacturing now ( well just ) in contraction mode at 49.9 .
first time contraction for 15 months # euro # fx # germany

here are the key points on germany 's unexpectedly poor manufacturing pmi report :   new orders fall for the first time since june 2013  production growth slows further  companies reduce their selling prices amid sharper drop in input costs

documents.title: german factories suffer first contraction in 15 months
text: bad news for germany - growth in its factory sector has ground to a halt after 14 months of steady growth .
russian sanctions , and the weak eurozone economy , appear to be hitting europe 's largest economy .
data firm markit has sent a shiver through the eurozone by reporting that german manufacturers suffered a fall in total new work last month .
german manufacturers reported the first drop in order intakes since june 2013 , with the pace of contraction the quickest since late 2012 .
markit says : new work from foreign markets , meanwhile , rose marginally , albeit at the slowest pace in the current 14-month spell of growth .
survey participants attributed the weaker expansion to the russian sanctions and subdued growth in main export destinations ( e.g .
china ) .
that dragged the german factory pmi down to 49.9 , showing a small contraction , and a big decline after august 's 51.4 .

german factory pmi , september 2014 oliver kolodseike , economist at markit and author of the report , says : september 's manufacturing pmi results paint a worrying of the health of germany 's goods- producing sector .
the headline pmi fell to its lowest level in 15 months , heavily weighed down by the sharpest drop in new orders since the end of 2012 .
surveyed companies reported that a weakening economic environment , russian sanctions and subdued growth in key export destinations were reasons behind the disappointing reading .
france 's factory sector continues to contract , though , but at a slower rate .
the french manufacturing pmi came in at 48.8 in september , up from 46.9 in august .

that shows that activity fell again , but at a slower rate. key points :  business conditions deteriorate at slowest pace in four months  rates of decline in output and new orders moderate  pace of job shedding eases markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) french manufacturing sector downturn eases in september , # pmi at 48.8 ( 46.9 in aug ) jack kennedy , senior economist at markit , says france 's economy is a concern : although the rate of contraction eased in september , the french manufacturing sector continued to struggle , with output , new orders and employment falling further .
there seems to be no end in sight to the persistently weak demand environment , and the pmi data suggest that the manufacturing sector will have weighed on gdp throughout the third quarter . ''

documents.title: italy 's factory sector returns to growth
text: good news from italy , its factory sector has returned to growth .
that 's according to markit 's pmi index , anyway , which rose to 50.7 in september from 49.8 in august - so back into expansion territory .

here are the key points from the survey :  modest increases in output and employment recorded  but new order growth slows to near stagnation  output prices reduced as cost inflation hits four- month low markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) markit/adaci italy manufacturing # pmi rises from 49.8 in aug to 50.7 it 's encouraging news for italy , after it fell back into recession this summer .

but phil smith , economist at markit , warns that the recovery remains fragile : nowhere is this more evident than in the trend in new orders , the rate of growth of which has slowed to a crawl over the past five months .
a further notable gain in new export orders pointed to the weakness coming from within the domestic market .
smith is also concerned that factories slashed prices again to stimulate demand .
september 's survey meanwhile showed some downward movement in producer prices as manufacturers sought to support sales through discounting .
the decrease in charges was only modest , but nevertheless adds to the broadening of deflation in the economy . ''

documents.title: russia 's factory pmi falls as export demand plunges
text: russia 's factory sector lost momentum last month as export demand fell sharply .
it 's manufacturing pmi dropped to 50.4 - close to the 50-point mark that shows stagnation .

markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) september 's hsbc russia manufacturing # pmi at 50.4 , down from 51.0 in august the sanctions imposed on moscow over the ukraine crisis may be hurting manufacturers .

markit reports that : while total new orders showed signs of stronger recovery , export demand plunged in september employment fell further and firms cut purchasing activity for the first time since may , it added .

factories in the netherlands grew at a faster rate in september , markit reports : but as with spain , manufacturers also reported that average purchasing costs fell last month , for the first time in four months .
markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) dutch manufacturing continues to expand at moderate pace in sep , # pmi at 52.2 ( 51.7 in aug )

documents.title: spain 's factory sector keeps growing
text: meanwhile in the eurozone , spain 's factory sector has posted another month of growth , based on interviews with purchasing managers across the country .
the spanish manufacturing pmi for september came in at 52.8 , according to markit .
slightly lower than august 's 52.8 , but still showing growth ( 50 is the dividing line between expansion and contraction ) .
markit also reported that firms paid less for their raw materials , another signal of low inflation in europe .
markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) spain mfg # pmi at 52.6 in sep ( 52.8 in aug ) .
input prices fall for first time in 5 months

city index 's josh raymond sums up the problem facing sainsbury 's et al : joshua raymond ( @ josh cityindex ) food deflation and smaller basket shopping means one thing lower profits for grocers # tesco # sainsburys # morrisons
coupe also defended that poster , urging staff to get customers to spend an extra 50p .
sean farrell ( @ farrell s ) sainsbury 's ceo says would n't have wanted 50p poster displayed in window but `` not surprising that we are in the business of selling things '' .

documents.title: sainsbury 's shares now down 4 % on dividend fears
text: hmmmm , sainsbury 's shares have turned south , down 4 % after mike coupe told reporters that its dividend policy would be part of its strategic review .

documents.title: sainsbury : 100 % confident in our accounts
text: sainsbury 's ceo mike coupe is holding a press call with reporters now .
he has insisted that the company is 100 % confident '' that it has been accounting for its commercial income correctly .

so , he does n't believe sainsbury has been conducting the same methods that got tesco into such trouble and asked about the market , coupe says conditions are the most challenging '' he has seen in his 30-year career .
my colleague sean farrell is on the call : sean farrell ( @ farrell s ) sainsbury 's cfo says 100 % sure that `` we account for promotional monies in the correct way '' .
sean farrell ( @ farrell s ) sainsbury 's cfo says no change to dividend policy but strategic review underway and co reviews div policy regularly .

documents.title: fca 's probe into tesco could be serious
text: retail analyst steve dresserman reckons that the fca 's decision to launch a 'full investigation ' into tesco 's is a significant development .
steve dresser ( @ dresserman ) fca investigating is significant as presumably criminal proceedings could take place if wrongdoing is established .
and as this site explains , the fca has a range of powers .

it can : investigate and take proceedings against individuals compel individuals to attend interviews make compulsory requests of individuals for information and documents punish individuals by way of financial penalty , public censure and/or removal of their regulatory approvals
the london stock market is open , and shares in j sainsbury are up around 0.6 % after this morning 's financial results ( details ) .
the city must reckon that it could have been worse rival morrison 's is the biggest faller on the ftse 100 , down 2.8 % .

documents.title: analyst : mike coupe copped a hospital pass at sainsbury 's
text: sainsbury 's new chief executive , mike coupe , must be looking enviously at his predecessor justin king , who enjoyed a decades-worth of rising sales before resigning to plaudits in the summer .
it 's rather similar to tesco , where problems emerged shortly after sir terry leahy stepped down three years ago to be replaced with the - now fired - phil clarke .
john ibbotson , director of the retail consultancy retail vision , says coupe has a real challenge on his hands .
with these results , it 's increasingly clear mike coupe took the hospital pass just like philip clarke .
yes , convenience and online may be moving in the right direction but the rot is setting in .
with everyone reducing prices and food inflation low , sainsbury 's has got its work cut out . ''
we got an insight into the situation at sainsbury 's yesterday , when it emerged that staff were being urged to get shoppers to spend an extra 50p on every visit .
a motivational poster was meant to be pinned up in the staff room , but unfortunately ( or not ) , one staff member helpfully stuck the poster up in a shop window for everyone to see .
as we reported : the fifty pence challenge '' poster was snapped by passerby chris dodd , who loaded his onto twitter .
the image was then rapidly retweeted by more than 3,700 people .
let 's encourage every customer to spend an additional 50p during each shopping trip between now and the year end , '' it read .
every little helps , eh ?
live well with 50p less sainsbury 's sales strategy gaffe
the 2.8 % drop in like-for-like sales at sainsbury 's ( ex fuel ) in the last quarter is n't quite as bad as some analysts had expected .
city traders are predicting that sainsbury 's shares could rise by 2 % -4 % when trading begins shortly .

documents.title: sainsbury 's slashes sales forecast as market turns tougher
text: the frenzied competition in britain 's supermarket sector has forced j sainsbury to cut its sales forecasts for the second half of the financial year .

new ceo mike coupe , who replaced veteran justin king in the summer , warned shareholders in this morning 's trading statement that the last few months have been tough , with many food prices falling ( great news for customers , of course ) an increase in price investment and short-term competitor promotional activity , combined with favourable commodity markets , has resulted in deflation in many areas of our food business .
coupe has now ditched the goal of growing sales in the next six months , after reporting a drop in comparable sales in the last 16 weeks .

· total retail sales for second quarter down 0.8 % ( ex fuel ) , down 2.3 % ( inc fuel ) · like-for-like retail sales for second quarter down 2.8 % ( ex fuel ) , down 4.1 % ( inc fuel ) · total retail sales for the first half flat ex fuel ( down 1.4 % inc fuel ) and like-for-like sales down 2.1 % ex fuel ( down 3.4 % inc fuel ) coupe warns : in the second quarter , our performance has been impacted by the accelerated pace of change in the grocery market , including significant pricing activity and food price deflation in many areas .
these conditions are likely to persist for the foreseeable future and we now expect our like-for-like sales in the second half of the year to be similar to the first half .

documents.title: fca launches investigation into tesco over £ 250m profit overstatement
text: big news this morning - the financial conduct authority has begun a full investigation into tesco .
the move comes nine days after the supermarket giant stunned the world of business by admitting that it overstated its profit forecasts earlier this year , by a staggering £ 250m .

tesco just gave the city the news in a brief statement : regulatory update the financial conduct authority ( fca ) has notified tesco that it has commenced a full investigation following the overstatement of expected profit for the half year which was described in our announcement of 22 september 2014 and which is currently the subject of an independent review by deloitte .
tesco will continue to co-operate fully with the fca and other relevant authorities considering this matter .
kamal ahmed ( @ bbckamal ) another gloomy day for the big retailers - fca announces full investigation into tesco accounts , sainsbury 's like for like sales fall 2.8pc

documents.title: the agenda : factory output data , sainsbury 's results
text: good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the financial markets , the world economy , business and finance .
coming up today a splurge of economic data from across europe and beyond , with the monthly manufacturing pmi index .
they 'll show which countries managed to grow their factory sectors last month , and which ones struggled .
preliminary data released a fortnight ago showed that france was faring rather badly , with activity falling again .
we 've already had mixed data from asia overnight , with india , japan and taiwan all seeing slower growth , while taiwan saw a contraction .

most of the european data comes in a rush after 8am bst , with the final eurozone figure at 9am , then the uk at 9.30am and the us at 2.45pm and 3pm ( there are two rival measures , markit and ism ) .
while in the city , sainsbury is reporting its financial results for the last 16 weeks , and confirming that it is also struggling as britain 's supermarket price war deepens .
like for like retail sales for second quarter have fallen by 2.8 % ( ex fuel ) , or a chunky 4.1 % if you count fuel too .

there 's going to be a lot of questions for new ceo mike coupe to answer ( including a conference call this morning ) we 'll also be watching greece as talks begin with its troika of lenders , and other breaking news through the day
